intro: Hibbertia ovata var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while the flowers are clustered in racemes. This variety is notable for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
